channel.title: How to start on a [PI]
channel.description: well hello evryone. i'm new on [PI] codeing style. i want to try and test it. when i tried to change my IP ( i found the client way) They said its only client sided, but i dont understand what they mean with that. Does that mean u dont have to change ure source his ip, since the versions i coded, needed the source id to change i would like someone to tell me if u have to change the ip in the source, and if i have to where, since i can't find it. Ty for reading this and i hope to have an anser pretty soon

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

dude pi>package>317 server its the same thing, but i dont like pi anyways lol

Read full topic

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

Thats all wrong. Let me tell you ;
1 - Only other players can connect to your no - ip
2 - To play your server make sure you set your client ip to “127.0.0.1”
Because you cant connect to urself when you’re the hoster

Np

Read full topic

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @eliasjuh12 eliasjuh12
item.description:
@eliasjuh12 wrote:

it isn’t maybe u should add me on skype and take a look to my files,… so u can see whats wrong (if ure able to find something)
since its pretty weird, no-ip i got a host name, port forwarding is kinda working. the only fact is i can’t get anyone on it (without useing hamatchi) but hamatchi isn’t realy usefull not if ure trieing to get some friends on it, and they want to add their friends ect.

name: roel(don’t add this) vanmarcke

Read full topic

try to send it to a friend, have them test it, sometimes you cant connect to your own ip, u have to connect to 127.0.0.1

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @eliasjuh12 eliasjuh12
item.description:
@eliasjuh12 wrote:

hmm, this is pretty anoying… my portforwarding = working
i get a correct signal from canyouseeme.org, but when i try to connect it aint working. my no-ip (duc) is running and my no-ip name is inside the client its still not working i guess i’ll try to make a new no-ip id or update the duc version could help at least i hope so

Read full topic

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

[quote=“eliasjuh12, post:5, topic:512234”]so its only inside the client i have to change the ip, not in the server.
I guess thats what i had to try and find out. since my portforwarding is bugged then.
i try to connect to my server but it aint working, ty for helping me out[/quote]
Np, yeah, its only done client sided. Check if your portforwarding was correctly done on canyouseeme.org (Make sure u have your source, no-ip etc running)

Read full topic

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @eliasjuh12 eliasjuh12
item.description:
@eliasjuh12 wrote:

so its only inside the client i have to change the ip, not in the server.
I guess thats what i had to try and find out. since my portforwarding is bugged then.
i try to connect to my server but it aint working, ty for helping me out

Read full topic

item.title: How to start on a [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

The ip is changed client sided, usually it is done in client.java (for most servers)

Try to look for something like server =

Here is an example of what one would look like: public static String serverip = “(ip here)”;

Read full topic

item.description:

ty, but its not like i can’t do that, i’m talking about the [PI] files, ive been codeing a lot on old 317 versions
the [PI] version is diff, i have no idea where to change that server ip (that was the main question) anyway thanks for replying

Read full topic
